Short description:
A little package for managing file paths in R projects.

Using `here` you can always get file paths that're relative to the project root which're expanded to the full system path.
What is the package or tool useful for?: Useful for managing file paths in Quarto/R Markdown files. If you have a nested .qmd or .rmd and want to put file paths in, you'll know when they render they set the working directory to the location of that file and not the project root.
Example Code:
# Create a new project, check you've got a .Rproj file in the project root.
# you can then just use the function:
here::here() # get the project path

# Example reading fake file
file <- here::here("data_folder/example_table.csv")
print(file)
# Read in data
# data <- read.csv(file)

Short description: Has super handy function for cleaning data, particularly cleaning column names
What is the package or tool useful for?: I use it most often immediately after I read in a file to clean the column names. It'll do things like remove special characters and replace spaces with underscores.
Example Code:
# Data with dirty column names
head(iris)

# Easy cleaning!
iris |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  head()

Short description: MultiQC is the standard in bioinformatics reporting.
What is the package or tool useful for?: Recently they have incorporated summaries using OpenAI, Seqera AI etc and user can make use of these summaries by creating a token easily. Good for interpreting the QC results.

Short description: Ilastik allows to segment images based on live training. You draw on the image examples of the different elements you want to segment and it updates the model live.
Renumber and relabel Numpy arrays at C++ speed and physically convert rectangular Numpy arrays between C and Fortran order using an in-place transposition. (https://github.com/seung-lab/fastremap)
What is the package or tool useful for?: Relabeling large segmented images (could be anything, but in my case confocal microscopy images)
